properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 8 at 9:29PM PST until February 11 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow possible along with northeast winds gusting to
50 mph. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during
the morning and evening commutes on Monday. Tree branches could
fall as well. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, with
amounts up to 12 inches in some areas, are possible.

* WHERE...Mountains of San Bernardino County above 4000 feet.

* IMPACTS...Light snow could impact the Cajon Pass near Cajon
Summit beginning Sunday night. Heavy snow could impact Highway
38 and Highway 18.

* WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant reductions in visibility are
possible.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant
snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue
to monitor the latest forecasts.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET
